data.text:
‘Delhi Metro Map’ PDF Quick download link is given at the bottom of this article. You can see the PDF demo, size of the PDF, page numbers, and direct download Free PDF of ‘Delhi Metro Map’ using the download button.

Delhi Metro Map PDF Free Download

Delhi Metro Map

Delhi Metro is the largest and busiest metro service in the country and is the second oldest metro after Kolkata Metro which is operated by Delhi Metro Rail Corporation Ltd.

It was started on 24 December 2002, its maximum speed is 80 km per hour and It stops at each station for about 20 seconds.

It was completed in the initial phase in 2006, then gradually expanded to Ghaziabad, Faridabad, Noida, and Gurgaon, adjoining the National Capital Region.

After the construction of the Delhi Metro, the pressure on India Roads has been reduced.

Delhi Metro has 10 color-coded lines and 253 stations, and the total length of the route is 348.51 km.

If Gurgaon and Noida Metro are included then it has 285 stations with a total length of 389 km.

The system has a mix of underground, at-grade, and elevated stations using both broad-gauge and standard gauge.

Delhi Metro covers 2700 journeys daily and it runs from 5:00 AM to 11:30 PM.

Line 1 – Red Line – Shaheed Sthal ( New Bus Adda), Hindon River, Arthala, Mohan Nagar, Shyam Park, Major Mohit Sharma Rajendra Nagar, Raj Bagh, Shaheed Nagar, Dilshad Garden, Jhilmil, Mansarovar Park, Shahdara, Welcome, Seelampur, Shastri Park, Kashmere Gate, Tis Hazari, Pulbangash, Pratap Nagar, Shastri Nagar, Inder Lok, Kanhaiya Nagar, Keshavpuram, Netaji Subhash Place, Kohat Enclave, Pitampura, Rohini (East), Rohini (West), Rithala
